text: Spanish police say they are still
looking for the man believed to have
driven a van into crowds in Barcelona
after earlier reports said he had been
killed an international manhunt is
underway after earlier reports had
suggested the main suspect was one of
the men shot dead by police after a
second attack so what do we know about
the Spay attacks so far well on Thursday
afternoon a white van ran into people on
las ramblas a famous boulevard in
central Barcelona it was packed with
tourists consequently 13 people were
killed and more than 130 were injured as
the van driver is said to have zigzags
along the pedestrianised area well
police say the driver managed to flee
from the area and about eight hours
later a second attack a car hits
pedestrians in the popular seaside
resort town of Cambria's 68 miles
southwest of Barcelona there a woman was
critically injured and died later in
hospital five other civilians and a
police officer were hurt well the
attackers vehicle overturned five people
got out some of whom were wearing fake
explosive belts and they were then shot
by police
four died at the scene one died later of
his injuries Simon Jones reports
on the boulevard we're on Thursday
bodies lay last night a vigil flowers
and candles to mark the lives lost and
those injured from 34 different
countries the disbelief and grief itched
on people's faces I was scared I was
scared nervous to come here and I didn't
know what it would be like and if
everybody was going to be kind of like
you know mourning and kind of upset over
what happened I mean it's good there's
everybody come together and just kind of
remember what happened through the
window of the museum new footage has
emerged that appears to show the van
speeding through the pedestrian area of
Las Ramblas in Barcelona people are
forced to run for their lives hours
later a car was driven into pedestrians
in the coastal town of Cambria's
five suspects were shot dead four by a
single officer among them Moussa oh
Kabir he's believed to have rented the
van used in the Barcelona attack but
police say they're still looking for the
man they now believe was driving it unit
Abu yaqoob the task of identifying the
dead and injured is continuing fears are
growing for Julien Cadman who's seven
and has dual british and australian
nationality he was separated from his
mother during the attack and is now
missing much to the concern of his great
aunt of course I'm really worried on us
I want to I cannot hear anything with
them I want to hear what's happening 15
people are in a critical condition in
hospital the morning and the police
operation continued Simon Jones BBC News
and we can just show you the live
pictures of the scene of that attack on
less and less there was a vigil held of
course last night and as you can see
this morning people still making their
way to that spot that one Miro mural you
can see there on the ground where the
attackers van ended up which is now
covered with floral tributes and candles
and messages of support
so in some ways the traffic moving
around that area life resuming if the
space is cleared and the area is
reopened but many people wanting to make

ongoing this morning
to show their solidarity after that
